stem: A lesion of the femoral nerve near the inguinal ligament would most likely impair which primary action?
rationale_correct: Femoral nerve innervates quadriceps femoris; primary action is knee extension.

rationale_distractors.A: Dorsiflexion is anterior leg (deep fibular nerve).
rationale_distractors.C: Eversion is lateral leg (superficial fibular nerve).
rationale_distractors.E: Inversion is mainly tibialis anterior/posterior (deep fibular/tibial).

evidence.citation: Heck C. Lower Limb Overview Handout (ANAT 505). Jun 16, 2025.
